name: Miguel
description:
'''Miguel Jontel Pimentel''' (born October 23, 1985) is an American singer-songwriter and record producer, who specializes in [[contemporary R&B|contemporary]] and [[alternative R&B]].  Raised in [[San Pedro, Los Angeles|San Pedro, California]], he began pursuing a music career at age thirteen. He signed with [[Jive Records]] to release his debut studio album, ''[[All I Want Is You (album)|All I Want Is You]]'' (2010). Though underpromoted upon release, it became a [[sleeper hit]] and spawned the hit single "[[Sure Thing (Miguel song)|Sure Thing]]", which went viral on TikTok in 2023; as a result, it reached a second peak of number 11 on the [[Billboard Hot 100|''Billboard'' Hot 100]] and remains his most commercially successful release.

After Jive's dissolution in 2011, he was moved to [[RCA Records]] and released his second studio album, ''[[Kaleidoscope Dream]]'' (2012) to continued success, spawning the hit single "[[Adorn (song)|Adorn]]". His third and fourth albums, ''[[Wildheart (album)|Wildheart]]'' (2015) and ''[[War & Leisure]]'' (2017) further experimented with [[psychedelic music|psychedelic]] and [[alternative music|alternative]] influences; the former peaked at number two on the [[Billboard 200|''Billboard'' 200]] while the latter contained the hit single "[[Sky Walker (song)|Sky Walker]]" (featuring [[Travis Scott]]), which received [[RIAA certification|triple platinum]] certification by the [[Recording Industry Association of America]] (RIAA). He later released ''[[Caos (Miguel album)|Caos]]'' (2025) to generally positive reviews from critics. Miguel incorporates various genres such as [[Contemporary R&B|R&B]], [[funk]], [[Hip hop music|hip hop]], [[Pop music|pop]], [[Rock music|rock]] and [[Electronic music|electronic]] into his music, and has been compared to vocalists such as [[Babyface (musician)|Babyface]] and [[Prince (musician)|Prince]].
